comments: Stay up with your work. If you fall behind in one part, it will seep into the rest of your work in the class.
Kinyarwanda is fucking dope as shit homeslice.
Good class, but professor's a tough grader!
Dr. Bayingana is an enthusiastic and exciting teacher who engages his students. If you want to really learn an African language, this is the class to take.
Make sure that you are willing to invest time in this class, and that learning the language is important to you, for it is very difficult to learn.
Absolutely!
Oscar Bayingana is an amazingly dedicated instructor!
you'll have fun!

Bayingana is a lot of fun. His English is good, but somewhat limited, which means that a question sometimes has to be rephrased before he answers it the right way. Other than that, though, the class is small, wonderfully personalized and well worth it. That classes like this are available is one of the reasons I love Harvard.
Wonderful, engaging, and dedicated instructor (Bayingana) and a good introduction to this beautiful though challenging language.
Bayingana is a great teacher, and really cares for his students
This language is beautiful and complex, and unlike any most students will ever have learned. The class is small, and the instructor is wonderful. Highly recommended.
you'll have an amazing time and learn a ton
You will love it.  Dr Bayingana is an incredible teacher and a wonderful person.

I was the only person in the intermediate classâ€”my two classmates from last year went abroadâ€”and it was a defining aspect of my year. A one-person class is exactly what the student makes of it; I wanted an intensive, rewarding experience, so I got one. I also lucked out with the instructor: Bayingana is a wonderful man, and I could not have asked for a better teacher. To anyone considering Kinyarwanda, for a requirement or just out of passing interest, I recommend taking it with utmost enthusiasm.

If you have interest in the Rwandan language, or have any desire to go to Rwanda in the future, then this course will be a perfect fit for you.  It has a strong emphasis on being applicable to life if you were to visit Rwanda.
very great class with a great teacher
If you have any interest in Rwanda, then this a perfect language to take!

This is an example of a great African language class: I have spent four semesters with classes of size one, two or three, had consistently close interaction with the instructor and learned about as much as I did in six years of high school Spanish. If for no other reason, take the class so you can meet Bayingana: ask him how many languages he speaks, how many countries he has lived in, how many degrees he has... really an amazing man.
If you are interested in African languages or Rwanda, this is a great course for you. It is perfect if you desire a small class size and individual attention when learning.
Study hard, write homeworks weekly, and take advantage of Bayingana's wonderful teaching and availability.

Kinyarwanda is a beautiful, challenging language. If you have never studied a Bantu language before, it is a great change of perspective from English or whatever you are used to. The instructor is knowledgeable and enthusiastic. I just finished my fifth semester of Kinyarwanda, and it has been a defining part of my education at Harvard.

Dr. Bayingana is a wonderful man and probably one of the most qualified teachers of this language outside of Rwanda. His enthusiasm and devotion, combined with the small class size (and the fact that it is such an interesting language) have made Kinyarwanda a highlight of my Harvard experience for six semesters running.
Dr. Bayingana is one of the best language instructors you can ask for. He has enthusiasm for teaching and he really makes sure that students benefit from the class.
Bayingana is a wonderful and dedicated instructor and I would recommend his Kinyarwanda courses to anyone!
you will love it!

This was my seventh semester of Kinyarwanda. The language is very difficult, but fascinating and beautiful. Dr. Bayingana is a wonderful, dedicated man, and there cannot be many other people in the world more qualified to teach Kinyarwanda at a university level. There's a reason I'm still here after so long.
A great class, and Bayingana is a wonderful teacher!
Kinyarwanda is a beautiful language and this is a hugely valuable class!
This course is great. Kinyarwanda is a beautiful, difficult language, and Dr. Bayingana is a wonderful teacher. Read the reviews from previous years; they're true.
Dr. Bayingana is an absolutely amazing instructor who puts a huge amount of work into his language teaching!  He cares deeply about his students, and puts his heart into the class.

If you are worried about only taking "useful" classes, don't bother with this one. You can definitely spend the rest of your life never hearing the word Ikinyarwanda (the language of Rwanda)again. However, you also will never get the opportunity to get a one on one cultural experience like this class. Harvard's African Department is amazing and this class is a trophy among the many languages you can take here. If you have room in your schedule, go for it! I do not regret it!
Oscar Bayingana is a wonderful instructor.  He tailors the course to student interests and needs, and his lessons are well-planned and challenging in the best possible way.
If you are looking to take an entertaining class and learn an uncommon language this is the class for you!
